details.html: Is your residence a hotel, commune, boarding house, barracks or shack?
What is this?
Residence types

Boarding house or commune or residential hotel
A group of 3 or more unrelated people who live together, share responsibilities and possessions.

Barracks
A group of unrelated people who live in the same building and have communal spaces like a lounge area or bathroom.

Shack
Shelter or dwelling made from pieces of wood, metal or other materials.
Are you sure?

Does this sound like your residence?

details.html: What type of residence is it?
Not sure? Review residence types
My residence is constructed and maintained according to prescribed building regulations.
Learn more
Residence types

House
A free-standing residential building occupied by a family.

Cottage
A fully functional structure on a shared property with itâ€™s own entrance.

Town house
A property that shares common areas with other residents in the same development.

Flat - Ground floor
A unit located in a block of flats on the ground level.

Flat - Above ground floor
A unit located in a block of flats above ground level.

Cluster house
A property that is built in groupings, with a shared wall within the home.

Park home
A prefabricated or container home.
Prescribed building regulations

Building regulations or building control refers to a structure that is built according to the prescribed South African building standards. This helps to ensure that all buildings are safe for people who are in and around it.

It is important to answer this question accurately as it could impact your future claims.
Does your home or any structure on the property have a thatched roof?
Do you have neighbours alongside each direct border of the property?
A neighbour is any occupied building along either side/s and back of your property, excluding those living across the road or opposite your property.

details.html: Have you had any burglaries/thefts or losses at the insured address in the last 7 years?
When did the most recent incident occur?

validation.requiredErrorMessage: Please fill in an incident date

details.html: Did you claim for this incident?
Will your home be unoccupied for more than 60 days in a year?

This is the total number of days the usual resident(s) will not be at home. This can either be a single long period of up to 60 days or multiple shorter periods that, when combined, add up to 60 days in a year.
Does your home have a burglar alarm that is in working order?
Always arm your burglar alarm when you leave home

• Your burglar alarm must be activated at all times while the home is unoccupied.
  • The alarm should always be linked to an armed reaction unit.
  • If the alarm is not activated at the time of the loss or linked to an armed reaction unit, loss and damages due to theft and burglary will be excluded.
What extra security measures do you have?
Select all that apply
